example: The book provides a veracious portrayal of life in a small town

name: vituperative
example: The online discussion quickly turned vituperative as participants exchanged insults and personal attacks

name: chaotic
example: After he became famous, his life became even more chaotic

name: confound
example: The magician's trick confounded the audience, leaving them in awe and unable to explain how it was done

name: dissemble
example: The politician tried to dissemble his true agenda by making vague promises and giving evasive answers

name: disseminate
meaning: The act of spreading or sharing information, knowledge, or ideas
example: Social media has become an effective tool to disseminate news and information quickly

name: ebullient
example: The children were ebullient as they ran around the playground, laughing and playing games

name: effete
example: The once-great empire had become effete and incapable of defending itself

name: equanimity
example: She faced the challenging interview questions with equanimity, answering confidently and thoughtfully

name: extravagant
meaning: Spending much more than is necessary
example: He rarely used taxis, which he regarded as extravagant

name: heterodox
meaning: Beliefs, or opinions that deviate from the accepted
example: The professor's heterodox theories challenged the established principles of the field and sparked lively debates among scholars

name: histrionic
meaning: Showing a lot of emotion in order to persuade others or attract attention
example: The actor's histrionic performance captivated the audience with its intense emotions and dramatic delivery

name: hyperbole
example: "The suitcase weighed a ton!" - This statement uses hyperbole to emphasize the heaviness of the suitcase

name: idolatry
example: The cult's leader exploited the idolatry of his followers, manipulating them for personal gain

name: inchoate
example: The company's business plan was still inchoate, lacking detailed strategies and a clear direction

name: indolent
example: His indolent attitude hindered his progress in achieving his dreams, as he lacked the drive to take action

name: lackluster
example: Despite the hype, the movie turned out to be quiet lackluster, failing to deliver on its promises

name: malinger
example: The student was caught malingering to skip school by pretending to have a stomach ache

name: spendthrift
example: Despite having a modest income, Lisa's spendthrift nature led her to accumulate significant credit card debt

name: stimulus
meaning: Something that causes growth or activity
example: Foreign investment has been a stimulus to the industry

name: vivid
example: Her vivid storytelling made it feel as if we were right there with her on that adventure

name: ally
meaning: Someone who helps and supports someone else
example: He is generally considered to be the prime minister's closest political ally

name: brisk
example: Business has been brisk lately

name: clutter
example: Sorry about the clutter in the kitchen

name: entrench
meaning: Established firmly so that it cannot be changed
example: Computers are now an entrenched part of modern life

name: rationalize
example: Management is thinking of ways to rationalize our system of production

name: tangible
example: We need tangible evidence if we're going to take legal action

name: allegiance
example: The soldier swore an oath of allegiance to defend his country at all costs

name: dichotomy
example: The dichotomy between good and evil is a common theme in many classic literature work

name: embody
example: The statue in the town square embodies the town's pride in its rich history

name: hassle
example: I went through a lot of hassle to be the first to get a ticket.

name: incongruent
example: Her knowledge of world politics was incongruent in someone so young.

name: radical
example: Her radical ideas on education challenged the conventional methods

name: slumber
example: After a long day of hiking, he fell into a deep slumber as soon as he hit the bed.
